column5: I worked New Year's Eve this year.  Rang in the new year with Hamilton's homeless. Have to say, surprisingly most of them were in bed well before midnight too!!

I worked New Year's Eve this year.  Rang in the new year with Hamilton's homeless. Have to say, surprisingly most of them were in bed well before midnight too!!  Good on ya!  Not an easy job.  We have a challenged city, so it is great to hear we have kind folks who help out with our social issues.  My brother works for the acquired brain injury clinic here in Hamilton and the stories he tells me......wow.

A trip to Vegas  New Years Eve , went for an awesome sushi dinner followed up by  a Britney Spears concert (gotta keep the wife happy) and followed up by an awesome Belagio fountain show and fireworks!!!  And....about fifty million people shoulder to shoulder.......lol
Thanks for the forum post.Thanks Again.

followed up by  a Britney Spears concert (gotta keep the wife happy)  Wow! I guess suffering is OK if it's for a good cause.  . Don't think I could take that much punishment, though----unless we were into S & M!!
mine was similar to Sinker's. Live band at my house, followed by lots of jamming, a fire burning outside, a few snowmobile rides....in bed by 5. Next day was a write-off!
It was a great night, thank you again for having me over, the crappie you cooked up was great and looking forward to sunday
Oh and we were never young eh? LMAO  Ours was quiet. Some hockey and treats then bed before the midnight ball dropped.

We cooked up a couple of lobsters and later flipped the channel between Niagara and NY. The music left no doubt that we are 'over the hill', clued out------didn't recognize any of the singers or their songs but the young folks in attendance were singing along!  Caught some of Ron James at Niagara---some pretty good stuff.

Oh and we were never young eh? LMAO  Ours was quiet. Some hockey and treats then bed before the midnight ball dropped.  Ya I know B, but when you're in a dead sleep and then the dog starts whining and barking and it sounds like gunshots outside, it's a tad annoying.   Now I know why my neighbors used to be so mad at me

Ya I know B, but when you're in a dead sleep and then the dog starts whining and barking and it sounds like gunshots outside, it's a tad annoying.   Now I know why my neighbors used to be so mad at me  See,you do remember.LOL
buncha grumpy ol men on here hahah
These days you get thrown in jail for the kinda things we, as a community, did on New Years Eve.
Well daughter & son in law invited me over for Chinese or should I say (ordered) me to be there... KIDS worried about Dad HAPPY NEW YEAR EVERYBODY oh my head hurts sorry

Pretty mellow crowd here..sheesh.  We partied, played tunes, and jammed until sunrise! Was a great time!! My guitar fingers are killing me, I had a bit of a head ache when I woke up, but it was all worth it!  S.

Well, I went to a lesbian birthday/ New Years party and it rocked! We  were kid free and completely took advantage! It was a fun time, those people are for the most part so nice and sure know how to party!!! Didnt get home until 3!
They do know how to have a good time don't they! I have a couple in my family (married) and they throw the best parties!  G
watched walking dead till I felt like the walking dead.....recorded some
They do know how to have a good time don't they! I have a couple in my family (married) and they throw the best parties!  G Such a good time! It was indeed a great party...

These days you get thrown in jail for the kinda things we, as a community, did on New Years Eve. When I lived in French River (some 35 or so years ago) we'd walk out on the front porch and let go with a couple of blasts with the 12 ga. at midnight. On a clear cold night you'd hear them going off for miles around. If I tried that where I live now I'd have the cops returning fire LOL. (No disrespect meant to our boys in blue, I wouldn't want to have to put up with what they do today for all the money in the world)
We used to let the shotguns rip at midnight as well. I considered it this year, but guns and booze aren't a good mix, so we didn't do it.  S
I went to bed ....  Slept right through it all. LOL Party pooper I guess

Usually for the last few years it's a struggle just to stay awake past mid night. We used to do the Dinner Dance thing but I say if I want to celebrate with a few hundred strangers and pay to do it I'll just invite my family over. My wife volunteered to work and close the store so she got home at 10:30 and I fed her Brodetto on Polenta. We were invited to come by the neighbors from Toronto as we are every year, we are the old folks here now. To my surprise she said lets visit the neighbors. We had a blast with the 30 something DINKS. We stayed to 3 AM. The best part was the 3 minute walk home, no waiting for a cab and no designated driver.  Happy New Years to all.

I'm pretty surprised at the replies.  Me, big game of shinny on the lake New Years eve day in a brutal wind, nice dinner and campfire later (brutal wind again), then I kept my 5 year old tradition going, in bed before 10:30,   there may or may not have been drinking involved

Cindy wanted to dance, so sushi was followed by a trip to the Danforth Music Hall, to see Dwayne Gretzky, a terrific 9 piece cover band, who played music from the 60s, 70s, 80s, and 90s. Packed house, great time.
hahaha awesome!
Copious amounts of beer a polar bear dip in the muskoka river and a deep fried turkey with good friends.
Did you get a shrivel factor of 99 Lickmy? You guys are kookoo, brave but kookoo. I bet the extra skives help.
Oh man you have no idea, I can see why a dip while ice fishing is so dangerous. That kind of cold stuns you. I have a video but didn't want to post it here way too many obscenities
I think lickmyarmpit wins the award for Canadian, redneck New Years Eve party, very cool!

Dinner at a nice Mexican restaurant called Milagro and then off to Massey Hall for a comedy show.  MC was Tom Green who was a little crude and so were a couple comedians in the first set.  I still can't understand why comedians think vulgarity is funny.  Anyway, highlight of the night was from the second most famous celebrity to come out of Timmins, ON, Derek Edwards.  Not vulgar, or a lot of swearing, just his recollection of life experiences that he tells and the whole place was roaring.

So here we sit waiting for safe ice.  Everything else has been discussed here while we're in between seasons.  lol!      So what did you do? My wife & I spent New Years at home watching TV (especially the Canadian juniors beating USA -Woo Hoo!).  Later in the evening she prepared 2 - 8oz lobster tails, shrimp with cocktail sauce while roasting a frenched rack of lamb!!  I drank a couple beers while watching the hockey game, 1 glass of wine during dinner (which was awesome!).  After dinner we watched the festivities at Times Square in New York.  Went to bed at 10:00! Happy New Year everyone!
Because of all the festivities of the evening it was a very late night for me and it was darned near 9:30 before I finally hit the hay.  Happy New Years all.
Pretty much the same as you minus the lobster,shrimp with cocktail sauce,Lamb,and wine during dinner  .Watched the games as well,few pops,nice quiet new Years.All the best everyone!!!!!!!!!!!

Made Sue and I a really nice dinner, rainbow trout (her favorite) with a maple/mustard glaze, Asian style green beans and a brown/wild rice mix. A glass of very nice wine.  About 7:30 I turned the clock ahead about 4 hours. We watched some tv and suddenly it was midnight; I kissed her and wished her a Happy New Year. Told her she could set the clock back now and I went to bed (might have even beat Lew LOL). (she always likes to stay up to see the ball drop then crawls into bed, give me a kiss, cuddles up and); well that's what dreams are made of!  Today is when I do my celebrating; just finished making a nice Swiss cheese sauce and crape batter, shaved a nice piece of ham, cooked up some asparagas. Friends are coming over around 10:30 so I'll be making ham and asparagas crapes with Swiss cheese sauce for brunch.  Wishing each and every one of you all the very best for 2015!
Happy New Year to All !!!
Sound asleep by 11:30 truck packed and ready to fish. Still trying to wake up my buddy to hit a lake lol
Will trade smoked salmon for some nice fresh specs
Sharpened hooks,   Headed north till Sunday, se y'all later.
Cliff - you missed your calling?  You shudda opened a restaurant!

I watched a bit of TV, fell asleep, was in bed by  10 or so...  The way I see it, every night I go to sleep is new years eve,since every day I wake up is the beginning of a new year  Best fishes for 2015   Maureen
Judy wanted to go to a big bingo hall for New Years Eve. Had a nice evening together, but it seems the Mrs has lost her "horse shoe"!
2 beers then bed
Ordered a mess of Chinese food, had a couple pops and went to bed.  G

Went out to a slow dinner 7-10 or so with many friends and brother and his wife (drank water with a bit of wine) got home at 1:30. Today it's a family day. Full dinner for all of the kids and spouses and the 7 grandkids. (17) Deciding whether to do lamb on the BBQ with the Roast beef, cannelloni and hearty soup with lots of shredded chicken and beaten eggs. (it's an Italian thing) If I fire up the BBQ I'll also roast chestnuts. At this  temp  I may be hugging the BBQ. It's going to be a long day
It's going to be a long day  But a fun one from the sounds of things !!
Went to Niagara Falls.  Heard traffic could be bad so I took the country roads home.  Best move I made in the New Year lol.
Yes Lew, they talked the Mrs into taking those noise thingies home, when they all arrive at about 4 pm the noise will start But then they come over every Sunday.

glad some of you made out ok....Me, not so well. felt funny all day my youngest was sick in the morn and by 5:30 i started to get sick to my stomach  made it to ball drop shaking under a blanket. Had to cancel our evening out. This morn my body aches from the heaving.  It can only get better from here!! Happy 2015!!!

Today is when I do my celebrating; just finished making a nice Swiss cheese sauce and crape batter, shaved a nice piece of ham, cooked up some asparagas. Friends are coming over around 10:30 so I'll be making ham and asparagas crapes with Swiss cheese sauce for brunch.   I'm looking forward d to roast leg of lamb tonight but DAMN this is making me hungry already lol. pics or it didn't happen  and Happy New Year to everyone. and stay inside today, the wind is absolutely brutal this morning !

we envited over some nieces and nefews. Had a good family dinner. watched hockey all day!  cracked a beer by ten(after the kiddos went to bed). had 4 beers then to bed with the better half about 1215.  was a great day! wanted to go ice fishing today but too many to tag along so were heading to the outdoor rinks for some shinny:)

Had some buddy's over and we played Rotten Apples and Cards against humanity. Both great and vulgar games if you get the right cards and the right time...  One of the couples just had a baby so they left around 11:00. The other couple was here until 1:30.  I feel hungover yet I didn't drink a stitch of alcohol. I guess staying up past midnight just doesn't agree with me anymore.

glad some of you made out ok....Me, not so well. felt funny all day my youngest was sick in the morn and by 5:30 i started to get sick to my stomach  made it to ball drop shaking under a blanket. Had to cancel our evening out. This morn my body aches from the heaving.  It can only get better from here!! Happy 2015!!! You aren't the only one, my head isn't feeling great either. Still had a good night, watched both hockey games, had some steak watched a movie and finally hit the sack around 1.

Had some friends over a-la potluck. I cooked up some crappie, dynamic_bear made his famous Jamalaya, other friends made homemade bread and crab dip. I'm not much of a drinker so I served as bartender for the evening. Good times had by all.  I wish I could get out on the ice today. Looks like Sunday will be the earliest.

I watched the The Walking Dead marathon and ate the Oxtail soup I made in the crock pot I got for Christmas, was delish, then went to bed about 11:30 and got woken up abruptly by Ralphie barking when some yackoff set off some fireworks for half an hour at midnight near my back yard!

threw a decent sized party at our house.  day started with the Canada Win, then the Leafs Win, the closed off with the Finland Win.  After the hockey was done, played DJ until 11:55 when we changed over to the NY ball drop.  Continued playing DJ until close to 3am until the house just about cleared out....  Enjoyed the final hour cleaning up the house.
